description: Number of ways to represent n using the binary operator a * b = 2^a + b.
formula: Sum_{n>=0} a(n)*q^n = 1/(1 - Sum_{n>=0} a(n)*q^(2^n) ).As n increases, a(n+1)/a(n) approaches the value x = 1.874542... satisfying 1 = Sum_{j>=0} a(j)/x^(2^j). [_David W. Wilson_]
maple: N:= 100: # to get all terms up to a(N)F:= add(a[i]*q^i,i=0..N) - 1/(1 - add(a[i]*q^(2^i),i=0..ilog2(N))):S:= series(F, q, N+1);sol:= {}:for i from 0 to N do  eq:= subs(sol, coeff(S,q,i));  sol:= sol union {a[i]=solve(eq,a[i])};od:subs(sol, [seq(a[i],i=0..N)]); # _Robert Israel_, Dec 12 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
